results.firPara: Ronald Koeman has said it would be crazy to consider Everton contenders for the Premier League title, despite their impressive start to the season.
results.secPara: Everton are second in the table, having taken 13 points from a possible 15, and maintained their unbeaten run under the Dutch coach with Saturdays 3-1 win against Middlesbrough.
results.webTitle: Ronald Koeman insists it is ‘crazy’ to consider Everton title contenders

results.webTitle: After 20 years and for one night only, Cologne reach Bundesliga summit | Raphael Honigstein

results.firPara: A stunning 2-1 victory over Juventus saved face for Internazionale just three days after arguably the clubs biggest embarrassment in almost three decades
results.secPara: A stunning 2-1 victory over Juventus saved face for Internazionale just three days after arguably the clubs biggest embarrassment in almost three decades

results.firPara: Roberto Firmino has been declared fit for Liverpools EFL Cup tie at Derby County, but there is still no place in Jürgen Klopps plans for Mamadou Sakho.
results.secPara: The France defender has not featured for Liverpool this season due to an Achilles injury, though he returned to training a fortnight ago.
results.webTitle: Roberto Firmino declared fit for Liverpool’s EFL Cup tie at Derby County

results.firPara: Carli Lloyd scored her 94th international goal, but the main chatter was again around Megan Rapinoe, who knelt during the national anthem before USAs 3-1 victory over Holland.
results.secPara: Rapinoe, who entered as a substitute in the 64th minute, took a knee during the anthem for the second straight national team match and fourth game overall. She has said she wanted to express solidarity with San Francisco 49ers quarterback Colin Kaepernick, who is attempting to bring attention to racial inequality and police brutality.
results.webTitle: Megan Rapinoe kneels again for anthem before USA's 3-1 win over Holland

results.firPara: • Former Uefa president Lennart Johansson led the way on to pitch
results.secPara: The Swedish club AIK tried a new initiative at the weekend, when the oldest living members of the club entered the pitch as mascots for their league match against Gefle IF.
results.webTitle: AIK  use pensioners as mascots for Gefle game in Swedish league

results.firPara: Plus New England are still the ultimate September team; theres hope for everyone in MLS; the Red Bulls inability to hold on to a lead

results.firPara: Emmanuel Adebayor has hit out at French club Lyon and accused them of a ridiculous excuse for deciding not to sign him.
results.secPara: The Ligue 1 club had been considering a move for the 32-year-old free agent and Adebayor met with Bruno Genesio on Friday, after the coachs pre-match press conference in which he said the striker could indeed sign, only to then pull out of any deal because of the veteran forwards participation in the Africa Cup of Nations with Togo and his ineligibility for the Champions League.
results.webTitle: Emmanuel Adebayor hits out at Lyon’s ‘nonsense’ excuse for not signing him

results.firPara: Walter Mazzarri has been praised for instilling a winning mentality at Watford by a player who contributed greatly to the Italians second victory as the clubs manager – Juan Camilo Zúñiga.
results.secPara: Zúñiga restored Watfords lead in their 3-1 triumph over Manchester United on Sunday, lashing a drive past David de Gea just 53 seconds after coming on as substitute with the score at 1-1 and United looking the more likely team to score next.
results.webTitle: Walter Mazzarri praised for instilling a ‘winning mentality’ at Watford
